website_summaries.verdict: Scanner junkies will love this multi-frequency, feature-packed unit. It has a learning curve but is worth every penny for its performance and reliability.
pros: Picks up frequencies clearly in analog and digital modes
Packed with features like Close Call RF Capture and location-based scanning
Some customization possible, such as connecting to an outdoor antenna
Great for home or auto use
cons: Initial programming takes time, as this isn’t a simple power-up-and-go scanner
No SD storage expansion on board

customer_reviews.title: This scanner does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I programmed my scanner manually to one city communications network. I purchased it in November 2018. It worked for a few months, then no longer transmitted. This happened twice...and now the third time today. It is never moved, turned off, or touched. Each time it stops transmitting, the frequencies disappear from the screen but it is still trying to "search". Each time that happened I had to delete all the memory and start programming it again.
customer_reviews.author: M. H. Muth

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and get this one. It’s great
customer_reviews.text: The BCD996P2 Arrived this morning. It’s a breeze to program with the computer. If you’re a bit of a scanner geek you won’t have much trouble. As for people who don’t program their own scanners or are just starting out and in too much of a hurry to learn the scanner you probably will get frustrated. I really like the quality of the audio coming from this radio. It’s very easy on the ears. I’ve been listening to p25 phase 2 out of three counties all day in my living room with just the stock antenna. The radio has a ton of features and anybody who likes tinkering and experimenting with radios will never get bored of this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Smith

customer_reviews.title: Better late than never...
customer_reviews.text: If you're located in a region where Phase 2 P25 or X2-TDMA is being used then it's a worthy upgrade -- even from the older XT series of scanners. It's virtually identical to the BCD996XT. The only noticeable change besides the product label is the USB mini port. The older, proprietary port was fine but the connectors did damage quite easily. The change to USB is welcome. Be sure you upgrade your BCD996P2 to the latest firmware for the best performance.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Carrigan

customer_reviews.title: One of the best available today!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great desk top scanner. It does have a "learning curve", which means you can expect to do some learning! My experience with software called "FreeSCAN" and RadioReference.com made set-up SO much easier. A 1-yr subscription to RadioReference is $60 at this time, well worth it as it does make set-up using FreeSCAN much easier! All in all, No Regrets, as the scanner price on Amazon is VERY good. I'm in a low spot, still reception has not been an issue. The sound quality is good, but there is always room for improvement. Otherwise, no complaints. It is complex, yet doable with some patience and flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: OffWorldEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure of what's in the box!!
customer_reviews.text: Would have liked to have been able to give a good review but this has been anything but a good experience. Sorry I can't rate the product itself because what was in our box was not what was advertised or what we bought. In the box was the Uniden Trunk Tracker lll model BCT15X. The only solution was to return this for a refund. No problem since it wasn't what we wanted. Now the price is higher. Make sure you're getting what is advertised and supposed to be in the box.
customer_reviews.author: sharon smith

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm really enjoying this scanner. I have it setup as a base unit. Most of the services in my area have gone digital, but not all. The seamless scanning between trunked systems and conventional systems with this scanner is exceptional. By far my favorite feature is the display alert. Programmed frequencies can be setup to change the display color when the channel is active. Very useful if the volume is low, and if you're annoyed by priority cutouts. I upgraded from a BC365CRS. I also own a BC355N for mobile use.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Steep learning curve and more items must be purchased to get this working.
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is almost impossible to program manually. You'll need to purchase third party software and a subscription to a database, then deal with a very steep learning curve. One more thing....the speaker is under the scanner so you'll need an external speaker for comfortable listening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for your money
customer_reviews.text: I love all the whistles and bells on this scanner. Simple to program. Like the option of different display colors for different programmed talk groups. Only thing I don't like is its range. Poor in my opinion. I have a older hd956d it's range is twice the distance of this scanner. Overall it's a nice add to all my equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Russell

customer_reviews.title: Took a month to figure out how to make functional.
customer_reviews.text: Finally figured this thing out kinda. Was fun to set up. I certainly hope it doesn't fail after a 75 mph drop onto the interstate, because the electronics are the same ones from the 80's. Seems like uniden has lost the desire to advance the product. I just hope this thing has the uniden durability from the past era. TOOK A MONTH to figure out how to program it. Uses the antique style usb thing, so you know the people that designed it are not going for convenience, or functionality so much. It needs a type c port.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Bargain for the functions!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at the most expensive model and compared to that. This is certainly a bargain! Fully adjustable priority scan modes and delays. Different colors and audible alerts for each frequency. Actually, there's too many bells and whistles to list. It's a feature packed receiver. Freescan software on line works fantastic. This is not a beginner scanner, and setting up the banks and sub banks takes some thought. Fun though setting it up! Over all a great value paired with my home brew Dipole!
customer_reviews.author: Hi

customer_reviews.title: Not for the Novice unless...
customer_reviews.text: The speaker is very basic (would advise a separate speaker). Programming is extremely difficult per the owner's manual (would definitely advise subscription of $15 for 6 months to radioreference.com--where in combination with the freescan software, will allow download and programming of scanner for frequencies you are interested in). In a rural, mountainous setting, I had to put a base antenna on my roof to pull in some but not all of the local frequencies, which are based 15-20 miles away.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent P25 Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: This BCD996P2 is an excellent scanner for use with the P25 systems. In my area I can pick up easily within a 30 mile range with the included antenna. While programming was not that difficult for me, there are plenty of videos online that you can refer to for programming. Sound and performance are really good. To program mine, I found some free software online to assist me.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerman

customer_reviews.title: If you are a fan of programming buy it.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great scanner and you get what you pay for. As far as being easy to use, that's a whole another story. Programming is not my forte. I am totally stupid when it comes to trying to input the codes. I actually sent it out to a radio programmer who knows what they are doing. After that whole process, I have to say that it's a great radio and I'm glad I purchased it. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Tschirhart

customer_reviews.title: My Review
customer_reviews.text: Bought the scanner for the wife as a Christmas present. Years ago use to have a analog one and she would listen to it for hours. Gotta tell ya though...it is tricky and monotonous to figure out the programing, especially when tryi g to categorize them (codes) into banks and groups.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. B.

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to program
customer_reviews.text: Had too end back - I was unable to program. Software only works with pc users - Not for Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl vespoint

customer_reviews.title: P25 system doesnt work, downloaded from scanner site.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several of the less expensive scanners. but what's irritaing is the lack of customer service. There are hidden costs for example if you want to receive NXDN DMR/MOTOBRO there are additional $50.00 and upwards costs for codes that you enter. When I've requested information on what the upgrades will do,all I get back is a suggestion to purchase a more expensive SDS model? I've yet to receive even one P25 channel, even when reprogramming it said nac upgrade needed?It's selling price good, but hidden upgrades easily make this 350.00 scanner closer to 500.00
customer_reviews.author: John Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner but...
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner for P25 I and II systems and analog trunked and non-trunked systems. Beware, this isn't your father's scanner as the nomenclature and system trees are totally new for those with previous scanner users. Saying there is a steep learning curve is quite the understatement but when you figure it out it's great. Digital squelch is an annoyance remover. As has been suggested, a 6-month or yearly account at readioreference.com and downloading the latest files assures your scanner is up to date with the seeming monthly changes. Pricey but well worth it to know what's going on in your city or town, especially with all the unrest and violence in 2020. Would buy again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nice scanner
customer_reviews.text: I gave the scanner 5 stars for "easy to use" but I warn you, I have been using scanners for 30+ years. If this is your first scanner, it may take a bit of time to get used to it. The days of crystals and two knobs is over. There are dozens of settings to use, many you will never touch. I think this is a great scanner for the price. If you are new to the hobby, give this scanner some time and you too will enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Gensel

customer_reviews.title: Simulcast results!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? 100% better then bcd536hp. Simulcast works! No garble like the other home patrols. I'm using proscan to program. It will take some time to get use to for programing even with proscan. I'm so use to home patrols setup. Otherwise it's a keeper!!! I don't have to play with p25 threshold. I leave it on auto. Homepatrol I had to change the settings and that would not be 100% at least I got this unit for a lower price like 368 instead of paying into the middle 400's like it was before because of Covid.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I replaced an analog version of this scanner ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I replaced an analog version of this scanner since our county upgraded their system. It is easy to program if one uses software called "Free Scan" and a web site called Radio Reference". They can be linked together to make programming a breeze. I was able to get my scanner up and running within minutes using those.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen B.

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS HARD AS IT LOOKS.
customer_reviews.text: NOT FOR A NOVICE. RECOMMEND HAVING THE PROS PROGRAM IT. I AM NOT TO THAT POINT YET. I AM FINDING IT IS NOT AS HARD AS SAID, IF YOU MESS UP, GO IN AND RESET TO START AND TRY AGAIN. MINE IS PULLING IN STATE POLICE FROM 150 MILES AWAY WITH A 30.00 OLD RADIO SHACK ANTENNA MADE FOR HIGH FREQUENCY. I RECOMMEND AN ANTENNA DESIGNED FOR DIGITAL SIGNAL. THEY ARE NOT THAT EXPENSIVE.
customer_reviews.author: RADIO JOHN

customer_reviews.title: Complex to program
customer_reviews.text: I have 40+ years experience using programmable scanners and I found this to be difficult at first. The user manual could be much better. Don't try to program from the front panel, almost impossible, use a programming software to program. The scanner preforms better than I expected, picks up distant signals good. Over all, I recommend this as a scanner for someone that has experience with programming trunking systems. If you are just starting out in scanning this could be difficult for you to use and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Randall A. Keeling

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner.
customer_reviews.text: A little bit of a learning curve to program, but once I programmed a few channels it was a breeze. Good clear sound. Numerous options and good support.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: It's like a digital BCT15X with more options
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a BCT15X so I could pickup digital trunking systems. The scanner is setup the same as the BCT15X. Using software like FreeScan in conjunction with the frequency and channel lists on Radio Reference made this easy and quick to program.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyG

customer_reviews.title: This scanner does everything,  I guess!
customer_reviews.text: Nice scanner I guess! Too complicated to program and instructions not easy to follow! I'm in the electronic field and I had a hard time getting the radio to do basic things.Saw it at another sellers website, they would set up your new radio for $130 per county plus the cost of the radio. I guess it comes down to how bad you want this radio and the cost of your set up time. I returned it to Amazon.It
customer_reviews.author: Hydrants56

customer_reviews.title: Awesome scanner
customer_reviews.text: Awesome scanner. It is a learning curve but once you get it, you got it. Best way to program it was proscan (paid service) and/or freescan (free service). Both are services are great.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Uniden Scanner with good reception quality and speed.
customer_reviews.text: This Uniden BC radio is what I expected as having owned many Uniden radios, too many to remember over the years. Now to add my observation regard this radio. First it is very easy to program with a computer. The necessary driver was easy to setup The manual was helpful when used a good loading program. Everything was easy considering I'm scanning a large EDAC system that due to the size I wouldn't want to load manually, took an easy 3 days Easy to use and program. recommend 100%.
customer_reviews.author: steven w

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of equipment - but there's a learning curve.
customer_reviews.text: These things have come a long way over the years. This scanner is definitely high quality and is what I was looking for. The only downside to it, is that there is quite a learning curve, specifically on programing it. There are YouTube videos out there on how to program and operate it; some are more helpful than others. Overall I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner. Does not do decrypted audio
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner. Does not do decrypted audio. I've messed with whistlers and this scanner. This is by far the best scanner I've used for P25 phase 2. Audio levels are good and programming with freescan worked with no problems. Do yourself a favor and sign up for a radio-reference account when programming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: impossible to program
customer_reviews.text: It takes a masters degree in electronics to program the codes and stations into the unit ... why can't a person just get to a channel and punch in the frequency you want in there??? I AM NOT HAPPY WITH THIS PURCHASE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: BCD996P2 radio comments.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't care for the fact that the radio arrived to me with an older firmware version. The first thing I had to do with the radio was update the firmware myself. Other than that issue I really like the radio a lot. Perhaps in the future the firmware version can be shown before purchase is made. Thank you for listening. GC
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Modern Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Handles trunking easily. I also bought the DMR upgrade so I can listen to local ham DMR systems. Uniden programming software is marginal - you will want 3rd party software (Proscan). Good sensitivity, no intermod and good selectivity. I now use a roof mounted ground plane antenna, but the supplied whip works almost as good. Sign up for the Radio Reference service to make it easy to download all your frequencies.
customer_reviews.author: Badabing

customer_reviews.title: I have not been able to program the fire frequencies.
customer_reviews.text: This product is used by civilians to monitor emergency departments in their local area. I have been unable to program this device to do that. At best I get garbled or clipped communications. At worst I get no communication.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance on most systems even with the small
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance on most systems even with the small, cheap antenna that comes with it. I can receive many transmissions from dozens of miles away and in my basement. Programming with software is a must, a subscription to radioreference and programming software will get you running very quickly. Very satisfied with this radio even though I haven't completely mastered using it. Using it is difficult to understand at first so if you want a simple scanner (if such a thing exists) get something else...otherwise it's probably the best mobile scanner you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not intended to be used by Novice users...!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Queensland Australia. I received my scanner yesterday and within one hour I had it running scanning local Police,Ambulance and Fire dept. I did not use any software to program, all done manually! It is NOT a toy scanner and . However if technically inclined You will master it quickly. Am very satisfied with it so far, Love it...!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Belair

customer_reviews.title: Hard to program.
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, it is hard to program. But, I was able to program it with my PC using 3rd party software. Other than that, it's a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Muffled audio spoils what seems to be an excellent radio
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't matter whether I use the internal speaker, a headset, or an external speaker, the audio is not as clear as the Whistler and Radio Shack scanners I use. Running it through an equalizer does not help. Programming with Freescan was a snap - it was up and running in minutes. Qverall, I like the scanner. It seems to be a bit more sensitive than the Whistler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless your a tech wiz
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to program even with additional parts suggestive spent a couple of hundreds dollars more and still don't have one channel programmed
customer_reviews.author: Jeff plum

customer_reviews.title: Lack of easy to use instructions.
customer_reviews.text: The unit did not have English Language instructions included. I was able to get them off the internet. However, I did not find them user friendly. I would not recommend purchasing w/o having someone else program it for you. I have a technical background and found it difficult to program.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Went Digital, not looking back
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my BC15X Uniden scanner with a digital model. Easy to program with a download from Radio Reference.com. Works good, sounds great with the internal speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Radio is made well but hard to use switching from 1 mode to another to use the many different ways you can use this scanner. not for a beginner but for the well advanced scanner user only
customer_reviews.author: Arnaud milner

customer_reviews.title: Very complicated to program
customer_reviews.text: You had better know a lot about technology and scanners to operate this. I would never been able to program this by myself. Luckily I knew someone that had one and did it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: bad sound
customer_reviews.text: Online setup was fairly easy. Sound quality was so bad that after a couple of days trying to listen to it I just couldn't take it anymore and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Reed

customer_reviews.title: Scanner Rocks
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome radio works great and gets everything I wanted. I suggest you download a software program to program the scanner or have the place where you buy it program it for you. It took me a week to figure it out using the software program, once you learn its a breeze. I wouldn't suggest trying to program it without the software because the manual is a little hard to understand. Once everything is setup the scanner is awesome plenty of room for thousands of channels. The APCO channels come in nice and clear with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Genereux

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Radio
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough for A novice like me to figure out, Love this
customer_reviews.author: Lori A. Meagher

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: before you buy one make sure you know what your looking for. this one needs programmed I did mine but if you don't know how have someone that can do it set up to do it for you. The unit works great.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: screen failure
customer_reviews.text: At first I was ordering a second one because I liked the product, prior to shipment of 2nd radio radio failed with no help and no screen I cancelled the order and lost $90.00 in the process plus shipping costs I will no longer deal with My goods for anything
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Real good scanner
customer_reviews.text: Everything so far is what I expected. With help from a friend, who has 2 of these, the programming went easy using Radio Reference's website. One drawback the speaker audio is a bit muffled so an external speaker will make the audio better. Once I get my discone antenna up I'm going to add a lot more frequencies.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Memolo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little unit for mobile or base.
customer_reviews.text: The options and ease of programming through third party software made set-up a breeze. Excellent little unit for mobile or base. I use it for both.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H.

customer_reviews.title: Great digital scanner/Bad for simulcast
customer_reviews.text: While the product itself it's top notch, it desperately needs to come with an available programming software. While there are free options this scanner will take hours to program even the simplest database without a bulk import. Very good for APCO but if you are looking to receive a simulcast system, buy a directional antenna or look elsewhere because it struggles with it. I am happy with the purchase but wanted to be blown away.
customer_reviews.author: Orie List

customer_reviews.title: Wish we wouldhave returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this purchase. Moved it to several different locations, still has lots of static. Hard to hear calls, I have better signal on a similar free app o. my phone. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Facer

customer_reviews.title: I love the scanner but the CLOSE CALL is a pain ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the scanner but the CLOSE CALL is a pain in the rear having to lock out channels every ten minutes or when passing a strong close call signal. Actually I don't think Uniden should have close call installed in a scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Osterstuck

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner
customer_reviews.text: Good scanner. Just be aware if you are in a DMR area you will have to pay to have it upgraded to DMR. Goid reception and clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Irene & Sam Heddinger

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for home or mobile
customer_reviews.text: Always loved Uniden Scanners. I originally purchased a Whistler, big mistake, sent it back. Any of today’s scanners are difficult to program. I joined Radio Reference and within minutes I was able to pick what I wanted. Programmed the scanner and was listening to it 30 minutes later.
customer_reviews.author: Marc J

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I love this scanner. Mounted it in my truck and bring it into the house for parties. Easy set up. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Billy

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best! The one I had before was so full of noise I couldn't listen to it. This is crisp and clear. Very little static. We are in an area that has reception problems and this is amazing. If your looking for a good scanner this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: have it pre programmed worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: SENT OUT TO SCANNER MASTER FOR PROGRAMMING $87.95 WORTH EVERY PENNY JUST GOT IT BACK AFTER 4 WEEKS AND IT SEEMS TO BE WORKING GREAT
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. The scanner is rather hard to program, esp if you don't know what your doing.... HOWEVER that has nothing to do with the seller. Would recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is great, hard to program but with time can be figured out. Shipping was slow because when it got to my town it came thru the post office. they don't move fast even if they are on fire.
customer_reviews.author: RET231

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Sounds great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Sounds great. Love it. Suggest you use FreeSCAN to program it. (Unless you are a rocket scientist.) I suggest a using FreeSCAN with a subscription to radio reference. Would suggest this product.
customer_reviews.author: David Miller

customer_reviews.title: very hard to program
customer_reviews.text: I have had this scanner since June 1st. and still haven't got it programmed yet, the instructions are complicated
customer_reviews.author: mickey

customer_reviews.title: Programming easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to program using radio frequency and the included I interface cable.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tomascik

customer_reviews.title: Its difficult to program
customer_reviews.text: Its difficult to program but my son got it. I love it the sound is so clear and picks up a lot of frequencies. I have to say this is the best scanner i have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: It works better than expectations
customer_reviews.text: Tuning and decoding p25 is a challenge. This radio is able to do it! You must tune your antenna properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over all radio is good quality
customer_reviews.text: To listen to public safety calls programming was difficult but love it once we learned how to program it had to buy an additional book to do that at an extra cost of $30:00
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great reception-challenge to program
customer_reviews.text: It works really well. Its a challenge to program. Ended up going online and downloading pc software to program it. If I could easily program it with out additional software I would have given it more stars no problem.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Houle

customer_reviews.title: Scan
customer_reviews.text: This scanner IS nice but wont scan out the box. Have to program.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy marciano

customer_reviews.title: The bear....cat
customer_reviews.text: Had this for over 6 months now, its as good as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great seller
customer_reviews.text: Great product shipping can’t a week earlier great seller !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best scanner I ever had
customer_reviews.text: It's really easy to program if you buy the software like I did. Love it. Set it up with labtech speakers from and old computer that I had several years ago. Sounds really good with those speakers. Not so well with the built in speaker. Picks up all the trunking frequencies and also the digital ones.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick L. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Works great. Does everything I want it to. Digital stuff is a bit harder to program than traditional scanner channels. But easy enough to figure out. Laptop helps.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Well made up to date scanner
customer_reviews.text: uniden is The best scanner maker hands down and this model is packed with features a true scanner hobbyist would want but it’s definitely not a plug and play scanner
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be in a hurry
customer_reviews.text: I like the the quality but I didn’t like the week it takes for other people to program it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Austermiller

customer_reviews.title: Scanner works
customer_reviews.text: We sold this to the end user and have had no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner. As a 30 year volunteer firefighter and EMT, this is imperative to me.
customer_reviews.author: Elwood Bluez

customer_reviews.title: A very poor simulcast p25
customer_reviews.text: Less than 5 miles from a p25 tower and it will not stay locked onto the system. A very poor simulcast p25 radio
customer_reviews.author: p mcentee

customer_reviews.title: It scans slower than the old analog scanners, causing ...
customer_reviews.text: It scans slower than the old analog scanners, causing you to miss the first part of radio traffic. Also a major difference in volume on digital and analog channels. Unit seems to work really well other than those two issues.
customer_reviews.author: Com Tech

customer_reviews.title: How to figure it out!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well it is very nice ! The only problem is that I can't figure out how to program it !! And the other problem is I am Disabled and my hands don't work that good !
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Great sensitivity and selectivity
customer_reviews.text: Great sensitivity and selectivity! Picks up very well and not much intermod from nearby strong signals. I would recommend this scanner to anyone who has the patience (it's not difficult) to learn the dynamic memory setup. P25 phase one clear as a bell also; Don't have phase II in my area yet. I like everything about the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Leach III

customer_reviews.title: Forget SD card scanners 996P2 is a winner!!
customer_reviews.text: My 996P2 destroys my WS 1095! I love this scanner the last P2 Digital base Mobile without a stupid SD card. Programing was easy just use freescan and update the firmware! Plus it can now receive DMR via upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: brandon marshall

product_meta.title: Uniden BCD996P2 Digital Mobile TrunkTracker V Scanner, 25,000 Dynamically Allocated Channels, Close Call RF Capture Technology, 4-Line Alpha display, Base/Mobile Design, Phase 2, Location-Based Scanning
product_meta.description: You can use the BCD325P2 to monitor police and fire departments (including rescue and paramedics), NOAA weather transmissions, business/industrial radio, utilities, marine and amateur (ham radio) bands, and air band transmissions. Features 25,000 dynamic channels.
feature_bullets: Uniden's BCD996P2 Digital Base/Mobile Scanner is a full-featured design with the serious hobbyist in mind. With an advanced digital decoding system and large memory bank, the Bearcat BCD996P2 scanner is an extremely powerful and useful Public Safety scanner.

The BCD996P2 comes equipped with Uniden exclusive features like Advanced Dynamic Memory System, Close Call RF Capture Technology, and GPS compatibility. It includes support for digital systems, including the latest APCO Project 25 Phase II systems.
Stay safe and informed with state of the art NOAA weather access and S.A.M.E. weather alerts that warn you of severe conditions in your area.

This mobile scanner radio offers 25,000 channels an advanced dynamic memory system, TrunkTracker V technology, and more. Enjoy location-based scanning and location alerts by connecting the BCD996P2 to an optional GPS receiver so you can stay informed when you’re on the go.

Included in the Box: BCD996P2 Scanner, AC Power Adapter, Vehicle Accessory Power Cord, Three-Wire Harness, Mounting Bracket and Hardware, Antenna, Owner’s Manual, APP Form, FREQ Form, other printed materials, and USB Cable.
NOTE:Kindly refer to the user manual provided as a PDF manual in the product description section
DCS/CTCSS Rapid Decode - Instantly Detects and Displays the Sub-audible Tone So You Can Quickly Determine the System Settings.
S.A.M.E. Weather Alert - Specific Area Message Encoding - During a NOAA Weather or Emergency Alert, a code for your specific location will alert you to severe conditions in your immediate area.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars492 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Digital T.T. IV, Close Call, 25000 Ch, 4Line Alpha display Base/Mobile, Phase 2
